    • Method Detail

      • startAlarmService

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> startAlarmService(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                         boolean noExit,
                                                                                         scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext ec)
        Starts a redis instance on a random free port (redis-server must be in your shell path) and registers it with the location service. This is the equivalent of running this from the command line: 
        
   tracklocation --name "Alarm Service Test" --command "redis-server --port %port" --no-exit

        This method is mainly for use by tests. In production, you would use the tracklocation app to start Redis once.

        Parameters:
        name - The name to use to register the alarm service with the location service
        noExit - if true, do not exit the application when redis exists
        ec - required for futures
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the redis server exits
